sentences.sContent: ...in line with past experience capital expenditure in the oil sector has dropped sharply in many producing countries...
...But why is America one of the advanced countries where the life prospects of the young are most sharply determined by the income and education of their parents...
...it is regarded as a special word to call those Chinese women who rushed to purchase a lot of gold when the gold price slumped sharply not long ago...
The report was sharply critical of the police.
sentences.sCn: 报道猛烈地抨击了警方。

words.tran: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
升半音；锐利的东西（如针、注射器等）
锐利；[摄] 清晰度；严厉

trans.tranOther: in a critical, rough or severe way
